contentrichtext.text: {{Update|inaccurate=yes|date=April 2012}} The '''XM1156 Precision Guidance Kit''' is a [[U.S. Army]] program to develop a [[precision guidance]] system for existing 155 mm [[artillery shell]]s.<ref name="GLOBSEC">[http://www.globalsecurity.org/military/systems/munitions/m1156.htm XM1156 Precision Guidance Kit (PGK) - Global Security]</ref> The prime contractor is [[Alliant Techsystems]] and the industry team includes Interstate Electronics Corporation.<ref name="ATKPGK_01">{{Cite web|url=http://www.atk.com/capabilities_defense/cs_ms_w_gp_pgk.asp|title=ATK Precision Guidance Kit (PGK) - ATK}}</ref> ==Overview== In operation the PGK will screw into the nose of the [[projectile]] much like the existing [[fuze]]. However as well as the fuzing function it will provide a [[Global Positioning System|GPS]] [[Missile guidance|guidance]] package and [[Flight control surfaces|control surface]]s to correct the flight of the shell. This is analogous to the addition of a [[Joint Direct Attack Munition]] (JDAM) tail-kit to a dumb iron bomb, creating a [[precision guided munition]]. The system began production in 2009, and was expected to be in service by 2010.<ref name="DEFNEWS_01">{{Cite web|url=http://defensenews.com/story.php?F=2793630&C=america|title=ATK To Make Precision Artillery Shell - defensenews.com}}</ref> Fielding is now expected to begin in spring 2013.<ref name="first">[http://www.army.mil/article/92810/ Fort Bliss Soldiers First To Fire Army's New Near-Precision Artillery Rounds] - Army.mil, December 11, 2012</ref> ==Specifications== * Guidance: GPS * Accuracy: ** Increment I: < 50 m [[circular error probable]] (CEP). ** Increment II: < 30 m CEP.<ref name="DEFUP_01">{{Cite web|url=http://www.defense-update.com/products/p/pgk.htm|title=Precision Guidance Kit (PGK) Improving the Accuracy of Artillery Fire - Defense Update}}</ref> * Unit cost: < $3,000 <ref>[http://www.aviationweek.com/aw/generic/story_channel.jsp?channel=defense&id=news/ARMY042507.xml Army munitions officials eye pending developments - Aviation Week]</ref> [[File:XM1156-PGK.jpg|framed|none|Diagram of XM1156 alongside standard fuse profile]] ==Program status== * June 2006: [[Raytheon]] downselected from XM1156 competition. * July 2006: [[BAE Systems]] and Alliant Techsystems selected to take part in a competitive Technical Development (TD) program. * May 2007: System Demonstration and Development (SDD) contract awarded to Alliant Techsystems.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://atk.mediaroom.com/index.php?s=press_releases&item=679|title=ATK Awarded Precision Guidance Kit Contract After Multi-Day Competitive Shoot-Off - ATK}}</ref> * October 2012: Soldiers from [[Fort Bliss]] became the first troops to fire the XM1156 guidance kit. 24 PGK-equipped projectiles were fired.<ref name="first" /> ==See also== * [[M982 Excalibur]] == References == {{Reflist}} ==External links== * [http://www.atk.com/Customer_Solutions_MissionSystems/cs_ms_w_gp_pgk.asp Precision Guidance Kit (PGK) -
